reviewText: Tim Burton definitely has a different way of looking at the world - and you can see this in these three movies!!  The Blu-ray Transfer looks good and you can't go wrong with these three movies for $10 (which is what I paid at the time).  Three good movies on blu-ray for $3.33 a piece??  No brainer!
summary: Tim Burton Triple Feature - what can you say?
Title: N/A

reviewText: All of the films looks very decent to great on Bluray but the transfers are fairly low bitrates around 20Mbps with Beetlejuice being the highest around 22Mbps. At 10 bucks or so you can't go wrong though. I like each film for its own reasons and you can find reviews for each of those somewhere else. All in all nice deal.

reviewText: If you have a DVD collection and have yet to upgrade it to Blu-ray, this trio of Tim Burton movies is a bargain - especially if you like the many faces of Jonny Depp.
summary: A Nice Collection of Tim Burton Classics

reviewText: Director Tim Burton has had a remarkably prolific career that has produced a long run of very successful and popular movies. He is renowned for such macabre, quirky, darkly comedic horror-fantasies as "Edward Scissorhands," "The Nightmare Before Christmas," "Sleepy Hollow," "Sweeney Todd," and "Frankenweenie," in addition to such varied fare as "Batman," "Ed Wood," "Mars Attacks!," "Big Fish," and "Alice in Wonderland." He has often worked with a stable of talented actors like Danny DeVito, Albert Finney, Martin Landau, Christopher Lee, Sarah Jessica Parker, Michelle Pfeiffer, Vincent Price, Alan Rickman, Martin Short, and Christopher Walken.The three movies in this compact set are among Burton's best-loved, one from his early oeuvre, the deliriously antic Beetlejuice (1988), and two more recent comedies, the subversive "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory" and the stop-motion animated "Corpse Bride" (both 2005). They of course star members of his repertory company: Burton's wife Helena Bonham Carter and friend Johnny Depp provide the lead voices in "Corpse Bride"; Depp also plays the lead in "Willie Wonka," for which he is again joined by Carter. In "Beetlejuice," Burton favorites Catherine O'Hara, Jeffrey Jones, and Winona Ryder are among the living, while the dead are played by Alec Baldwin, Geena Davis, and Michael Keaton in the title role.The high quality of these family-friendly films, the excellent picture and sound on Blu-ray, the multiple bonus features (commentaries, featurettes, deleted scenes, trailers, etc), and the low cost of the three-disc set all make it a winning value. Highly recommended!
summary: Enjoy a terrific Tim Burton triple feature on a budget
